The name "of course," when written out as a sentence, looks like something you would write if you were trying to make yourself sound smart. It contains all the right words, but they aren't actually correct. For example, there isn't any way to say "I am not a robot." Instead, we use the word "of course" because it sounds more intelligent than saying nothing at all. This technique has been used extensively throughout history, from ancient Greek poetry to modern advertising copywriting.
